definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: Some vendors hoodwink outside tourists by charging them exorbitant prices.
sentences.chinese: 有的小販漫天要價，坑騙外地遊客。

sentences.english: The unlawful trader cheated the consumers by selling them fake and inferior commodities.
sentences.chinese: 這個不法商人銷售僞劣商品坑騙消費者。

sentences.english: He defrauded the company of one million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他坑騙了這家公司一百萬美元。

sentences.english: True friends will not cheat with each other.
sentences.chinese: 真正的朋友不會相互坑騙。

sentences.english: Soon after they had left the dogs, the wolf came at the lamb and ate it up.
sentences.chinese: 狼勝利地坑騙了羊羣，喫掉了小羊羔。
